intro: Gratiola heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf gravelroot, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its succulent, hairy stems and alternate leaves that vary in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Gratiola heterophylla is adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
